thread.title: Patrick Mailata first Kiwi boxer up at world champs
thread.title_full: Patrick Mailata first Kiwi boxer up at world champs

author: Logan Savory
title: Patrick Mailata first Kiwi boxer up at world champs
text:
Patrick Mailata first Kiwi boxer up at world champs LOGAN SAVORY Last updated 12:07, October 6 2015 Phil Walter 
New Zealand's super heavyweight boxer Patrick Mailata. 
Three of the four New Zealand boxers at the World Championships in Doha have been handed first round byes. 
Chad Milnes (60kg), Josh Nyika (69kg) and David Nyika (91kg) will all advance to the second round without throwing a punch in the first round action on day one of the tournament. 
For New Zealand's brightest hope, David Nyika, he will take on Rustam Tulaganov in his first fight, with the prospect of taking on the top seed in the heavyweight division, Erislandy Savon of Cuba, in the quarterfinals. 
READ MORE: 
Patrick Mailata, in the super heavyweight division, will be the first New Zealand boxer to fight at the 2015 world championships. 
He will take on Brazil's Rafael Lima Duarte in the first round. 
Twenty-year-old Mailata has big wraps on him from many in the amateur ranks and has already attracted interest from professional promoters. 
There will be many eyes looking on to see if he can deliver of that promise when he takes to the ring in Doha. 
Like Nyika, Mailata is on the path for a quarterfinal showdown with the super heavyweight's top seed, Ivan Dychko from Kazakhstan. 
Josh Nyika will take on the winner of the Josh Kelly (Great Britain)-Nathan Webber (Australia) clash in the second round of the 69kg division. 
Milnes will fight either Reda Benbaziz
